design_intent: To provide immediate and unambiguous confirmation to the user that a previously identified error or issue (referenced by ID 1770398091599) has been successfully resolved, thereby reducing user anxiety and guiding them towards continued product usage.
design_spec: A dedicated full-screen modal or page to confirm the error fix. The screen will feature a prominent 'Error Fixed!' header, a descriptive message confirming the resolution of issue 1770398091599, and a clear call-to-action button labeled 'Go to Dashboard' to redirect the user to the main application interface. No complex interactions or additional information will be presented to maintain clarity and focus on the resolution.

children.name: BodyText
children.characters: The issue with ID 1770398091599 has been successfully resolved. You can now proceed.

validation_checklist: 1. Can a new user predict what happens next?: Yes, the clear 'Error Fixed!' message and 'Go to Dashboard' button make the next action entirely predictable.2. Is anything explained too late?: No, the core message of the fix is presented immediately. Further details, if needed, would be linked, but the primary intent is fulfilled upfront.3. Does the UI match the intent?: Yes, the simple, direct confirmation screen with a single primary action perfectly matches the intent of informing the user about a fix and guiding them forward without friction.
summary: Designed a minimalistic and clear confirmation screen for error-fix-1770398091599. The screen ensures users are immediately informed of the resolution and can seamlessly navigate back to the product's main interface, aligning with the product belief of being obvious without documentation. The design prioritizes clarity and a single call-to-action to minimize cognitive load.
